article.headline: Boston College 84, New Hampshire 62
article.story: BOSTON (AP) -- Jared Dudley scored 18 points and grabbed 10 rebounds Tuesday night, leading Boston College to an 84-62 win over New Hampshire. Jermaine Watson scored 16 points, Craig Smith 13 and Nate Doornekamp 10 for BC (2-0). Doornekamp also had 10 rebounds. Mike Christensen and Chris Vetrano each had 16 points to lead New Hampshire (2-1). The Eagles, who led 38-31 at the half, broke the game open by outscoring UNH 28-7 in the opening 9:05 of the second half. During the spree, Louis Hinnant had three consecutive 3-point plays, the first two on 3-point shots, in a 50-second span as BC scored the first 11 points after intermission. After the Wildcats outscored BC 7-2, the Eagles went on a 15-0 run over the next 4:15. Watson scored six straight points in the middle of the run. BC's biggest lead of the game was 66-38 on Hinnant's fastbreak layup with 10:55 to play.

statistics.description: The number of points scored.

statistics.name: assists
statistics.description: The number of times a player who passes the ball to a teammate in a way that leads to a score by field goal, meaning that he or she was "assisting" in the basket. There is some judgment involved in deciding whether a passer should be credited with an assist.

statistics.name: turnovers
statistics.description: The number of times a player loses possession to the other team.
